verses.text: 1 "JESUS_END"How beautiful are thy feet with shoes, O prince's daughter! the joints of thy thighs are like jewels, the work of the hands of a cunning workman.
2 "JESUS_END"Thy navel is like a round goblet, which wanteth not liquor: thy belly is like an heap of wheat set about with lilies.
3 "JESUS_END"Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins.
4 "JESUS_END"Thy neck is as a tower of ivory; thine eyes like the fishpools in Heshbon, by the gate of Bathrabbim: thy nose is as the tower of Lebanon which looketh toward Damascus.
5 "JESUS_END"Thine head upon thee is like Carmel, and the hair of thine head like purple; the king is held in the galleries.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-6/" title="Song of Solomon 7:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6  "JESUS_END"How fair and how pleasant art thou, O love, for delights!
7 "JESUS_END"This thy stature is like to a palm tree, and thy breasts to clusters of grapes.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-8/" title="Song of Solomon 7:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8  "JESUS_END"I said, I will go up to the palm tree, I will take hold of the boughs thereof: now also thy breasts shall be as clusters of the vine, and the smell of thy nose like apples;
9 "JESUS_END"And the roof of thy mouth like the best wine for my beloved, that goeth down sweetly, causing the lips of those that are asleep to speak.
10 "JESUS_END"I am my beloved's, and his desire is toward me.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-11/" title="Song of Solomon 7:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11  "JESUS_END"Come, my beloved, let us go forth into the field; let us lodge in the villages.
12 "JESUS_END"Let us get up early to the vineyards; let us see if the vine flourish, whether the tender grape appear, and the pomegranates bud forth: there will I give thee my loves.
13 "JESUS_END"The mandrakes give a smell, and at our gates are all manner of pleasant fruits, new and old, which I have laid up for thee, O my beloved.
